Articles.Content:
I just learned that Explorer program which was American response to sputnik is still operational 

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explorers_program](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Explorers_program)

I used to think that it was ended long time ago
So, you didn't know about the dozens of Explorers that were launched?

> 
> So, you didn't know about the dozens of Explorers that were launched?

I known abut the sattelites, but i did not know that it was "explorer family" for me Explorer as is Sputnik are always associated with historical missions.

> 
> I known abut the sattelites, but i did not know that it was "explorer family" for me Explorer as is Sputnik are always associated with historical missions.

Yup, Bill Phil, he meant that he didn't know that some modern satellites are still a part of the Explorer program.

Frankly, I didn't know that myself, that's really cool!
I did not know this was considered the same on-going program, either.
Explorer 7 is still in orbit after 55 years! Interesting.
Nice find! I always associated the explorer program with older satellites too.
